comment: Attend class, pay a little attention, make an A!  Really, it's that simple.  Easy grader, easier assignments.  Some of the information is a bit redundant, some of it is interesting.  Professor Lovig is nice and approachable, quite unorganized, and easily manipulated (suggest that a due date gets moved, he'll likely move it).

Prof. was slow to grade, never answered emails, missed posting his own assignments. Left the entire class confused on what was needed to be done. 12 quizzes (unlimited attempts) lowest 4 were dropped, 2 tests, 2 papers, 3 online discussions (was supposed to be 4). Not sure if prof actually read the papers or just gave a 100 for completion.

MGT 4170.  I felt this was an easy class ? I got an A.  I took him for the online section.  Quizzes could be taken as many time as you needed.  Tests were limited to 1 attempt.  I think my class caught him at a time where his day job and life got a bit busy for him.  There were a few times were we went 2-2 Â½ weeks without hearing anything from him.
Great Professor. Lots of real applicable experience. Lots of little projects but nothing hard.

AWESOME CLASS! Best professor I have ever had at KSU. Real life stories to tie in subject. If you have the chance to take him, DO IT! Encourages participation and gets to know students. Makes class personal! LOVE THIS TEACHER!
GREAT TEACHER!Helpfull , funny, knowlagable. I loved this Human Resources class. One of the best classes I took.

Prof. Lovig is very knowledgeable at the subject he teaches and he keeps the class interesting by telling stories and relating the material to real-world situations instead of reading from the text like a lot of professors do. The class was fun and he made the notes available online. Loved the class
